intro: Hieracium barbigerum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium barbigerum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes become invasive in non-native regions.
